comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hzrandd

comments.content:
Does "offline migration" means non-live migration?

Also, what is the behavior you are seeing? If the destination is down, then it should error out in compute when it tries to prepare the destination for migration. If you are seeing some exception/stack-trace, please put it up.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sumanth-nagadavalli

comments.content:
I think it should be live migration, since cold migration do not need to specify a target host. 

But for live migration, I think nova already do the checking.

root@liugya-ubuntu:~# nova live-migration vm1 xxx
ERROR: Compute service of xxx is unavailable at this time. (HTTP 400) (Request-ID: req-e50171f6-b581-4ca2-ae68-f5e4b66f3406)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jay-lau-513

comments.content: Right, you should be seeing an error in the nova compute or at least the scheduler log about a NoValidHost error.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: Hi. What version of nova are you running?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mikal

comments.content: oh,sorry. the offline migration should be called cold migration.  the nova version is folsom.
